descricao: Whimsical potions of Obojima island for use in adventures

pocoes.descricao: When you drink this frothy liquid, you can perfectly mimic the call of any songbird for 24 hours.

When you drink this grainy potion, a 1-foot-diameter bubble emerges from the top of your head. The bubble lasts for 1 hour and moves with you, remaining centered on you. Until this effect ends, you can choose to project your thoughts into the bubble, where they manifest as illusory but silent words or images (your choice), which anyone can view.
When consumed, you smell of an expertly crafted perfume. The effects of this potion last for 22 years. This does not count against the number of potions that can be affecting your body at one time.

When opened, this potion begins to evaporate rapidly. For 1 minute, as the potion evaporates, ladybugs fly out of the bottle at a rate of 500 per round. The potion stops producing ladybugs once it has evaporated completely.

This potion makes everything taste amazing. When you pour it on any food, it doesn't matter if it's a piece of tofu or a slice of slow-roasted brisket, the essence of umami makes it glow with magic. When the food is tasted, it magically gives the taster their own personal version of the ultimate dining experience.

Once ingested, you can perfectly mimic the speech of a person you are unfamiliar with. If you cannot think of a person you have never met, you instead mimic a random voice. The potion's effects last for 1 hour.

Drinking this hairy liquid gives the sensation of having wool rubbed against your entire body. When consumed, you instantly grow facial hair, even if you normally wouldn't be able to. The style of facial hair is random, and it stays on your face until shaved off. This does not count against the number of potions that can be affecting your body at one time.
This vibrant green potion tastes like freshly cut grass. For the next 24 hours, while the sun is out you regain 1 hit point at the start of every hour.

After drinking this potion, you are instantly adorned with striking and distinctive plumage. You can control it to create dazzling displays of bright feathers, iridescent colors, and striking patterns. When you do so, you gain advantage on all Charisma (Performance) checks made to distract or impress. The effects of this potion last for 24 hours.
When unstoppered, this silver elixir produces beautiful, ethereal music for 1 hour as it slowly evaporates.

It stinks and now so do you! After drinking this potion, all other creatures within 15 feet of you must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be unable to willingly move closer to you for the duration. A creature that hasn't made this save must immediately do so when it moves within 15 feet of you. The potion's effects last 1d4 rounds.

This potion is easily mistaken for brackish water. Once you drink it, you can produce one egg, stone, coin, or 2-foot length of rope from your mouth. This effect lasts until utilized. This does not count against the number of potions that can be affecting your body at one time.

After consuming this clear, flavorless potion, you quickly undergo a radical transformation, becoming the toddler version of yourself for the next 4 hours. For the duration, you are one size smaller (to a minimum of Small), and your Strength and Dexterity become 10 unless those scores are already lower than 10.

When consumed, this multi-colored potion allows you to produce a variety of oil paints from your fingertips. You can change the color of the paints at will, and they never seem to run out. The potion's effects last for 8 hours.

When opened, this embarrassing and noisy potion sounds like a grown man weeping. When consumed, this potion uncannily silences the sound produced by any spell cast by the drinker for the next 60 minutes.

A potion well known among investigators and merchants, this thick broth acquires special insight into an object when poured onto it. The only downside is that you must then lick the broth off the object to gain any of this information. When poured and then licked, the potion reveals a bit of minor but useful information about the object.

When consumed, this potion tastes as if it were freshly brewed tea with the perfect amount of honey stirred in. For the next 60 minutes, you are unable to speak without singing, and possess advantage on Charisma (Performance) checks using your voice.

This nearly weightless liquid grants drinkers the attributes of a dandelion seed, allowing them to drift safely to the ground when falling and be easily carried on the wind. For the next 60 minutes, you are under the effects of the feather fall spell and weigh no more than 1 pound.

Is this just booze? For the next 60 minutes, you become incredibly intoxicated. For the duration, you gain expertise in one skill of your choice, which means your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. Until this effect ends, all ability checks you make that don't use the chosen skill are made with disadvantage.

As part of the bonus action to consume this potion, you speak a message and burp a bubble, which magically holds the message inside it. You then describe a creature you are familiar with and the bubble floats to that creature, traveling at a speed of 1 mile per hour, and then pops. The bubble pops prematurely if it takes any damage. When the bubble pops, it releases the contained message in your voice.

This aqua-blue potion is cold to the touch and raises the hair on your arm when opened. When poured into a nonmagical liquid, it turns the liquid invisible for 1d4 hours. If the liquid the potion is poured into is larger than a 20-foot cube, the potion has no effect.

This inconspicuous potion temporarily doubles your age when consumed. The potion's effects last 1d12 months. This does not count against the number of potions that can be affecting your body at one time.
This dull, underwhelming potion coats your mouth and throat as you drink it, leaving a thin film. For the next 60 minutes, every liquid you consume turns to wine as you drink it.
When shaken and pointed in a direction, the contents of this snappy elixir shoot out of the bottle, transforming into a poisonous snake in midair and landing in a space within 10 feet of you.

You are filled with intense feelings of confusion before an apparition emerges from your body that resembles a young girl with onyx skin and hair and piercing green eyes. Only you can see her, and she cannot speak. She functions as the unseen servant spell and lasts for 1 hour.

This bitter potion grants you a special form of speech that sounds like absolute gibberish to anyone not also under the effects of a hsirebbig potion. Even spells such as comprehend languages fail to decipher this speech. The effects of this potion last 24 hours.

After drinking this potion, you feel the sudden unpleasant sensation of wearing soggy clothes. For the next 10 minutes, you gain a flying speed of 15 feet and can hover, but look and feel as if you are swimming through the sky. While flying in this way, you must also abide by the rules for underwater combat.
When brewed, this powerful elixir stores one of the creator's memories of their choice within it. When consumed by another creature, that creature gains the stored memory.

This mischievous slime can sometimes form in place of a potion. If noticed before being consumed, it can be thrown to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you, releasing the slime as it shatters. After throwing the potion, a soda slime appears in the space and acts of its own accord.
When you apply this oil to an object, you assign a signature sound that accompanies the object when it is used. This effect is permanent unless removed as a curse.

After drinking this earthy concoction your form rapidly shifts and shrinks. You immediately polymorph into a mossy spirit, as by the spell. This effect does not require your concentration and ends after 1 hour.
After drinking this wondrous liquid your spirits lift and optimistic feelings wash over you. You gain advantage on the next 1d4 ability checks, attack rolls, or saving throws you make.

This potion can be split into up to eight parts. When two or more creatures consume this golden elixir, they gain a conditional fly ability. For the next 24 hours, creatures that consumed the elixir gain a flying speed of 60 feet, but only while holding hands with all other creatures that partook of the potion.
Once consumed, this potion summons a rain cloud that weeps for you. Then in a flash of lightning, your head takes the form of an anthropomorphic animal chosen by the DM. This effect is permanent.

This bitter and unappealing elixir turns your stomach and is often a struggle to keep down. Once consumed you grow a 6-foot-long prehensile tail, which takes a form decided by the DM. The tail can be used as if it were a third arm and can easily support your own weight. The tail lasts for 1d12 days before falling off.

When poured onto an object that weighs 500 pounds or less, it begins to weigh lighter and lighter. The object weighs up to 1d100 pounds less at the start of every hour until it weighs exactly 10 pounds. It remains weighing 10 pounds for 1 week, after which the effects of this potion fade.

This unappealing potion allows the drinker to eat anything that can fit in their mouth without ill effect—metal, poison, seawater: you name it, you eat it. The effects of this potion last 1 hour. Any magical object consumed in this way is puked back up after the end of the hour.
When buried and left to rest for 24 hours, this potion will sprout and form a temporary portal to the Spirit Realm from tangled roots and mud. The portal stays open for 24 hours before closing.

When consumed, this viscous broth tastes like wet soil. For the duration, you become immune to the prone condition. Whenever you would fall prone, you instead stay standing as if held upright by an invisible force. Even by choice, you cannot fall prone. The effects of this potion last 10 days.

When poured out, this silvery liquid quickly expands and coats the surrounding area, creating a chalky white sheen on anything it touches. For the next 8 hours, gravity in a 20-foot-radius, 300-foot-high cylinder centered on the potion is like the moon's gravity. Jump distance for all creatures within the cylinder is tripled, and falling damage taken within the cylinder is halved.

When consumed, this potion causes your hair to grow at an accelerated rate. Roll 1d4 + 2 and multiply it by 100 to find out how many feet of hair you grow. After 1 minute the potion wears off and all your hair falls out.
When poured over an object that is Small or smaller, the object becomes invisible. The effects of this potion last until removed as if a curse.
When brewed, this potion assumes the essence of a random humanoid within 1 mile. A creature that consumes the potion assumes the appearance of that creature for the next 24 hours.

This bitter mixture tastes and smells awful to physical beings, but couldn't taste more delicious to spirits, many of whom would trade quite a lot for a sip of the stuff. A spirit with challenge rating 8 or lower that consumes this potion becomes drunk and happy for 1d4 days. Alternatively, the potion can be poured out, attracting spirits with challenge rating 2 or lower that are within 1 mile. When poured out, the potion attracts spirits for 8 hours or until consumed.

When consumed, this inconspicuous elixir magically transforms your head into a random anthropomorphic animal, such as a horse, panda, pig, or raccoon. This effect lasts until removed as if a curse. This does not count against the number of potions that can be affecting your body at one time.

Once consumed, this potion gives sentience to your shadow. The shadow begins acting independently of you but is still attached to your body. It has its own emotions and personality but cannot interact with the world in any way beyond what a normal shadow could. The effects of this potion last until removed as if a curse. This does not count against the number of potions that can be affecting your body at one time.
When you drink this metallic potion, your body twists and alters into an object of your choice, as by the true polymorph spell. This effect does not require your concentration and ends after 1 hour.

When ingested, this elixir burns your throat and lights an ember deep inside you. For 24 hours, you are immune to fire damage. When the potion's magic finally fades, the fire inside you burns brightly from within, consuming you in flame and turning your body to ash. 1 hour later you appear at the nearest campfire, reborn anew. All items and clothing that were on your person when turned to ash are left by your original body.

This bizarre mixture of tastes is reminiscent of fresh cut grass, petrol jelly, and honey. When consumed, it sits in your stomach like a rock and slowly swells in power. You gain the ability to cast a random spell of 6th level or lower, without expending a spell slot. This spell uses a save DC of 17 and a spell attack bonus of +9. The effects of this potion last until the spell is cast. This does not count against the number of potions that can be affecting your body at one time.

When this potion is poured out, an illusion of your choice appears in your space, as by the major image spell. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check. The illusion lasts for 1 hour.

When poured onto a surface that is at least a 50-foot square area and is uncluttered by obstacles (such as trees or boulders), this pungent liquid begins to rapidly foam and expand. After 1 minute a newly formed and fully furnished house of grandiose size appears in the space.

When ingested, this acrid elixir untethers your soul from your body and prepares it for transfer. The first time you are touched by a creature after consuming this potion, your mind and soul transfer into that creature's body. While inhabiting the creature's body, you can force it to make a contested Intelligence or Wisdom check (you both choose which ability to use) at the start of each of your turns. If you succeed, you gain full control over the creature until the start of your next turn. While your mind and soul are away, your body falls unconscious. If the creature dies while your mind and soul are still inside it, you die as well. You inhabit the creature's body for 1 hour, until you dismiss the effect as an action, or until the creature is targeted by a dispel evil and good spell.

The brewer of this potion chooses the likeness of a humanoid they are familiar with. When ingested, you take on the illusory form of the chosen creature. This illusionary disguise is perfect in every way and matches both the appearance and voice of the creature. Only creatures with the ability to detect magic or see through illusions (such as with true seeing) can discern this disguise. The effects of this potion last for 7 years or until removed as if a curse. This does not count against the number of potions that can be affecting your body at one time.
When poured onto a creature or object, this creamy elixir instantly awakens the target, as by the awaken spell. The awakened creature remains charmed by you for 1 year, instead of 30 days.
When poured out, this dark elixir stains the earth and creates a 10-foot cube that is void of the island's magic, as if under the effects of the antimagic field spell. This effect lasts for 1 year.

When consumed, you feel a wave of magical inspiration flow through you. You instantly learn a random 3rd-level spell. You can cast it without expending a spell slot, and once you do so, you can't cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest. The effect of this potion is permanent, and does not count against the number of potions that can be affecting you at one time.

The crafter's brew can be added to any larger vessel of water or a small body of water to create an enchanting bath. The first nonmagical object submerged in the water for at least 1 minute gains a permanent magical effect. This effect is random and powerful enough that the item's rarity should be considered uncommon or higher.

After drinking this potion, you no longer walk or run—you now dance. Going from place to place is no longer a mundane trek, a dragging expression of boredom. How you go from point A to point B is now a dazzling dance performance. From gentle elven waltzes, to the hopping and spinning Nakudama, to the interpretative dance forms of the dara, you explore them all. Your dashing movements increase your walking speed by 10 feet, give a +5 bonus on Charisma (Performance) checks involving dance, and grant proficiency in Dexterity saving throws if you don't already have it. This lasts until you dismiss the potion's effects as an action.

When you drink this potion, your hair turns dark red (presuming you have any), and you gain the ability to speak with chickens permanently, as by the speak with animals spell. IN ADDITION, you can crow a sacred and thunderous cluck that summons 100 chickens in a 20-foot radius centered on you. These chickens appear running from a distance, digging from the ground below, and falling from the sky in a veritable tsunami of flapping, clucking poultry. Each creature in the area (excluding you) must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 30d6 slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you have summoned the chickens in this way, you cannot do so again. This does not count against the number of potions that can be affecting your body at one time.
When consumed, your body vanishes along with all items you were wearing or carrying, and your consciousness is transferred into a random object within 100 miles of you.
